moisture from Atlantic air, feeding hardwood forests, blue-hazed valleys, and some of the richest temperate biodiversity on Earth. Weather stacks on the windward slopes and rains out along the Blue Ridge—why the Smokies smoke, the streams surge, and autumn erupts in color.</text> <images> <image slot="1"> <caption>Blue Ridge layers fading into dawn</caption> <stockSearch recommendedQuery="Blue Ridge Mountains layers mist sunrise"> <shutterstock>https://www.shutterstock.com/search/Blue%20Ridge%20Mountains%20layers%20mist%20sunrise</shutterstock> <adobeStock>https://stock.adobe.com/search?k=Blue+Ridge+Mountains+layers+mist+sunrise</adobeStock> </stockSearch> </image> <image slot="2"> <searchPhrase>new river gorge bridge fall foliage</searchPhrase> <stockSearch recommendedQuery="new river gorge bridge fall foliage"> <shutterstock>https://www.shutterstock.com/search/new%20river%20gorge%20bridge%20fall%20foliage</shutterstock> <adobeStock>https://stock.adobe.com/search?k=new+river+gorge+bridge+fall+foliage</adobeStock> </stockSearch> </image> </images> </story> </featuredStories> <meta> <generatedAt>2025-12-29T15:48:24.319440+00:00</generatedAt> <sourceWorkbooks> <workbook>Copy of Revisions for geophysical domain.xlsx</workbook> <workbook>atlas_stock_links_shutterstock_adobe.xlsx</workbook> </sourceWorkbooks> <exclusions> <exclusion>Elevation profile callouts are intentionally omitted from this export.</exclusion> </exclusions> </meta> </continentPoster>
